page.title: 09Our Local Environment.
page.content: Apart from Northern Letchworth ,Southern Stotfold ,the village of Norton and the hamlets of Radwell and Nortonbury our survey area is farm land.Most is arable including wheat,barley,oats,potatoes,peas and beans.Two farms rear pigs.The river Ivel runs through this area as does the County Boundary between Hertfordshire and Bedfordshire.The Boundary is a bank and ditch with bushes on each side.Cowslips and other unusual plants grow in the field s which have been used for horse grazing for many years.Many small springs reach the surface in some of the fields near the Ivel.
